required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immuno-bridging Study of Inactivated SARS-CoV-2 Vaccine in Healthy Population Aged 3-17 vs Aged 18 Years Old and Above
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity Non-inferiority Immuno-bridging Study of Inactivated SARS-CoV-2 Vaccine in Healthy Population Aged 3-17 Years Old vs Healthy Population Aged 18 Years Old and Above

lead_sponsor.agency: China National Biotec Group Company Limited

collaborator.agency: Beijing Institute of Biological Products Co Ltd.

clinical_study.source: China National Biotec Group Company Limited

brief_summary.textblock: This is a open label clinical trial to evaluate the efficacy, safety and immunogenicity of inactivated SARS-CoV-2 vaccines (Vero cell) in healthy people aged 3-17 years old in comparison with healthy population aged 18 years old and above

detailed_description.textblock: This is a open label clinical trial to evaluate the efficacy, safety and immunogenicity of inactivated SARS-CoV-2 vaccines (Vero cell) developed by Beijing Institute of Biological Products Co., Ltd in healthy people aged 3-17 years old in comparison with healthy population aged 18 years old and above. Total of 1800 healthy volunteers aged 3 years old and above will be enrolled, of whom the subjects will be divided into two groups, 3-17 years old group and 18 years old and above group with each consisting of 900 volunteers. The 3-17 years old group was further divided into three subgroups: 3-6 years old, 7-12 years old and 13-17 years old, with 300 volunteers in each subgroup. 2 doses of vaccines will be injected into the deltoid muscle of either upper arm according to the immunization schedule of D0, D21 (+7 Days). Based on interim analysis'results of the booster dose administered to adults aged 18 years old and above, a booster dose might be introduced.

primary_outcome.measure: The four-fold increase rate of anti-SARS-CoV-2 neutralizing antibody
The Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of anti-SARS-CoV-2 neutralizing antibody
primary_outcome.description: Neutralizing antibody assay will be performed using the Microcytopathic assay

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of the vaccination to 28 days after the full course immunization
secondary_outcome.description: the adverse event at injection site and systemic adverse event and other adverse events of the subjects are actively followed up and recorded in the subject diary card or follow-up calls

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety index-Incidence of serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of the vaccination to 6 months after the full course immunization

secondary_outcome.measure: The four-fold increase rate of anti-SARS-CoV-2 neutralizing antibody
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after booster dose of immunization

secondary_outcome.measure: The Geometric Mean Titer (GMT) of anti-SARS-CoV-2 neutralizing antibody
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after booster dose of immunization
secondary_outcome.description: Neutralizing antibody assay will be performed using the Microcytopathic assay

secondary_outcome.measure: The distribution of neutralizing antibody titer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after 2 dose of immunization and booster dose
secondary_outcome.description: The proportions of neutralizing antibody titer

arm_group.description: 300 subjects receive 2 dose according to the immunization schedule of D0, D21 (+7 Days). A booster dose might be introduced.
300 subjects receive 2 dose according to the immunization schedule of D0, D21 (+7 Days). A booster dose might be introduced.
300 subjects receive 2 dose according to the immunization schedule of D0, D21 (+7 Days). A booster dose might be introduced.
300 subjects receive 2 dose according to the immunization schedule of D0, D21 (+7 Days). A booster dose might be introduced.

intervention.description: 0.5 mL per dose, containing 6.5U inactivated SARS-CoV-2 antigen
